title: 107_hr557
content: The Act is titled the "Deposit Insurance Fairness and Economic Opportunity Act." It allows the use of excess deposit fund reserves to pay FICO interest obligations and provide rebates. The "Deposit Insurance Fairness and Economic Opportunity Act" allows the use of excess deposit insurance funds to pay FICO interest obligations and for other purposes starting January 1, 2002. The Act allows excess deposit insurance funds to be used to pay FICO interest obligations from 2002 to 2017 and for other purposes after 2017. The Act allows excess deposit insurance funds to be used to pay FICO interest obligations from 2002 to 2017 and for other purposes after 2017, including transferring funds to the Financing Corporation and insured depository institutions as determined by the Board of Directors. The Act allows excess deposit insurance funds to be used for FICO interest obligations and other purposes, including transferring funds to the Financing Corporation and insured depository institutions. Amendments include a payment limitation for certain institutions and technical changes to the Federal Home Loan Bank Act. The Financing Corporation can access funds transferred by the FDIC Board of Directors under the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. Amendments include limitations on payments for certain institutions and technical changes to the Federal Home Loan Bank Act. Section 2703(c)(2) of the Deposit Insurance Funds Act of 1996 is amended by changing references and redesignating sections as per the Deposit Insurance Fairness and Economic Opportunity Act.
